data.name: AppendSnapshotToCommit
data.value:
UPDATE Commits SET Snapshot = @Payload WHERE StreamId = @StreamId AND StreamRevision = @StreamRevision;
UPDATE Streams SET SnapshotRevision = @StreamRevision WHERE StreamId = @StreamId AND @StreamRevision > SnapshotRevision AND @StreamRevision <= HeadRevision;

data.name: GetCommitsFromSnapshotUntilRevision
data.value: SELECT C.StreamId, C.CommitId, C.StreamRevision, C.CommitSequence, C.Headers, C.Payload, C.Snapshot FROM Commits AS C INNER JOIN Commits AS M ON C.StreamId = M.StreamId WHERE C.StreamId = @StreamId AND C.StreamRevision BETWEEN M.StreamRevision AND @StreamRevision AND M.StreamRevision <= @StreamRevision AND M.Snapshot IS NOT NULL ORDER BY C.CommitSequence;
data.comment: This statement works for all implemented SQL dialects. Even though it looks ugly and could be re-written more elegantly, it's a more compatible statement (unfortunately).

data.name: GetCommitsFromStartingRevision
data.value: SELECT StreamId, CommitId, StreamRevision, CommitSequence, Headers, Payload FROM Commits WHERE StreamId = @StreamId AND StreamRevision >= @StreamRevision ORDER BY CommitSequence;

data.name: GetStreamsRequiringSnaphots
data.value: SELECT StreamId, HeadRevision, SnapshotRevision FROM Streams WHERE HeadRevision >= SnapshotRevision + @Threshold ORDER BY SnapshotRevision - HeadRevision;

data.name: GetUndispatchedCommits
data.value: SELECT C.StreamId, C.CommitId, C.StreamRevision, C.CommitSequence, C.Headers, C.Payload FROM Commits AS C INNER JOIN Dispatch AS D ON C.StreamId = D.StreamId AND C.CommitSequence = D.CommitSequence ORDER BY C.CommitStamp;

data.name: MarkCommitAsDispatched
data.value: DELETE FROM Dispatch WHERE StreamId = @StreamId AND CommitSequence = @CommitSequence;

data.name: PersistCommitAttempt
